message.content:
cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.SP, cs.NA, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of recovering block-sparse signals, which is a topic in signal processing and machine learning. The use of Bayesian methods and hierarchical models suggests that the paper may belong to the Information Theory (cs.IT), Machine Learning (cs.LG), or Signal Processing (cs.SP) categories. The focus on sparsity and structured-sparse solutions further supports these categories. The use of an expectation-maximization (EM) algorithm suggests that the paper may also belong to the Numerical Analysis (cs.NA) category. Finally, the use of hyperparameters and statistical dependencies among coefficients suggests that the paper may belong to the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) category.
